poem:
"Portrait of the Market"

O the red and green 
of Halfords' shares,
plummeting like fallen apples,
tumbling in morning air.

Caught amidst flight of credit,
the ringing of bicycles,
Vernal promise whittled
by the sharp edge of profit's fall.

In daylight's oblique tilt,
an unscheduled warning echoes,
not of April's wealth blossoms,
but cold forecasts of leaner gain.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Halfords shares plunge after unscheduled profit warning Halfords shares have plunged by almost a quarter after it issued an unscheduled profit warning, in part because of more consumers buying bicycles on credit. The motoring and cycling retailer said it expected to post profits of between £35m and £40m for the year up to this April, well down on its initial forecast of between £48m and £53m. In a trading update to the market on Wednesday,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Halfords shares plunge after unscheduled profit warning Halfords shares have plunged by almost a quarter after it issued an unscheduled profit warning, in part because of more consumers buying bicycles on credit.
